translation:
Most Excellent Sir

There are people who, supposing they bother you, do not do so as continuously as I do, because I am obliged by circumstances to importune you, not only out of my respect but also for others, as now happens, that having before yesterday asked for funds for the hospital, now I ask for myself; I am quite certain of what you told me to say, yet necessity compels everything, and therefore one patacão or two patacões is all that suffices for one who has not a vintém nor anyone to ask for it except Your Excellency. Your Excellency

From Your Excellency’s very old and obliged friend Antônio José de Abreu S.C., April 21, 1840.

I sent three patacões. (a) Almeida. Plus 2 patacões on the 28th. Plus 10 said on the 30th of this month. Charged to the Hospital. Most Illustrious Most Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida. 1840 April 30.
